dialogue.raw_text: (quietly) You're making a mistake.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Everything is all right, John.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (to the youth) Pick up the hat.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Never seen anything like that in all my years.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (covering) He's from... Ohio... My cousin.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: We'll, them Ohio Amish sure must be different. (addresses a gathering crow) Our Lancaster brethren, they just don't have that kind of fight in them.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: John, lost control of himself. He... will be repentant.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (to Rachel) You're Rachel Lapp, aren't you?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yes. Samuel! We're going.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Kid's nose is broken!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: We'll take him up the hospital. Good- day to you, Mrs. Lapp. (he shouts after her) This ain't good for the tourist trade, you know! You tell that to your Ohio cousin!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . BARN / CARPENTER'S SHOP  DUSK Book comes out of the carpenter's shop carrying the repaired birdhouse on its pole in one hand, a shovel in the other. Rachel is shepherding the milking cows toward the barn.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She nods, looks away... looks back at him twice in glances. There is a moment when it appears she might either bark at him or begin to weep. He waits. When she does turn to him, she speaks softly:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He has offended her, immediately knows it, but can't bring himself to make an instant apology. But he's chewing on it when she takes the moment unto herself. She pulls herself up, speaks with great dignity:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He looks at her, sad-eyed, his anger ebbing and gone, realizing that he'll never meet a finer woman... never even get close to such a one. He appears to start to speak, but then does not. She turns, moves away a few steps, stops, looks back at him. she holds for a moment, blinking tears, then speaks with some difficulty, emotion welling in her words.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She holds for an instant, then turns and walks off.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: You should not bother with that birdhouse. (a beat) If you're leaving tomorrow.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I'm leaving tonight. (and) I'm going to need my clothes. And my gun.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: There was a time when I thought you might have stayed.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (hesitating... then) There was.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: There was a time when I would have welcomed it.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (after a beat) I know.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (asking) I was being foolish?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No. (and) I was being unrealistic. Even thinking about living this life.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You're so sure of that?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Aren't you? After today?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (almost conceding it, but... her voice rising a bit, annoyed) I'm not so sure of anything as you are, John Book. You could live this life if you wanted to bad enough. (a beat) Just as I could live yours!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (almost groaning) Oh, come on, Rachel. No way.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: There is always a way! But you are such a... a Glotzkopp you cannot see! You'd rather go back to that city! To nothing! No woman! No children! No land!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (now getting annoyed) Land! Are you crazy? I'm no Amishman and I'm no farmer! I'm a cop. That's what I know and that's what I do!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What you do is take vengeance! Which is a sin against heaven!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: That's your way, not mine.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: That's God's way!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Well in the City of Philadelphia, God needs a little help!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I could never love a man who was so... little.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: The other night... when you saw me after my bath... I... I tried to look as I thought you would want a woman to look. (sadly... but with a slight, proud lift of chin) I am sorry... that I did not.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Looking after her. A face full of loss.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . KITCHEN  DUSK Eli is lighting the lamps. Samuel reads a book at the kitchen table. Rachel moves slowly to the sink and begins washing a few dishes. She looks out the window.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: on her face, a strange expression.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . / EXT RACHEL'S POV  DUSK The distant figure of Book working on the birdhouse.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . KITCHEN CLOSE on Rachel's hands, lifting items slowly up and of the water to the draining board, where she places them carefully down. She shakes the water off her hands.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: on her face, still staring fixedly out the window. She speaks without turning around.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The old man glances at her; this is not their routine.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Eli, would you see Samuel to bed?
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . DRIVEWAY  DUSK In the rapidly fading light, Rachel walks slowly toward Book.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: on her face, staring straight ahead toward Book.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: on Book, CLOSE. He turns and watches Rachel's approach.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The light now nearly gone, the NIGHT SOUNDS beginning, as Rachel reaches Book and they embrace.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . FIELD BY ROAD  NIGHT Book and Rachel in a passionate embrace, sink to the still warm earth and make love.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . SOUDERSBURG CAFE  LANCASTER COUNTY  NIGHT ESTABLISHING an all-night cafe in the early hours of the morning.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: to the bleakly lighted windows.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A booth, where Schaeffer and McElroy and Fergie, a Lancaster County Undersheriff and his SHERIFF  an expansive politician type  are seated. The Undersheriff eyes Schaeffer narrowly. The Sheriff has a county map spread out on the table, amid breakfast dishes, pointing directions to Schaeffer:
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: There... White Oak Road a couple of miles before it ties into two-twenty- two. Got it?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Got it. We owe you one, Sheriff.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: My man Holmes here put it together. Fine officer, Chief. He spoke to the doctor at the hospital.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Undersheriff Holmes and I have talked on the phone. (nods at Holmes) Good work.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Sure you don't want us to post some backup units?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: If we need any help, we'll give you a shout. I'd like to slip in there quiet, then get out before we attract any attention.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . CAFE PORCH  DAY As Schaeffer and his men are climbing into their car. Holmes and the Sheriff watch after them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But Holmes pauses to watch Schaeffer's car pull out.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Maybe I'll take a drive over that way.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Let 'em be. It's their dirty laundry.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . RURAL LANE  LANCASTER COUNTY  DAWN With the first light of dawn on the eastern horizon, Schaeffer's car approaches along the lane, pulls into the Lapp driveway and comes to a halt. In the b.g. we can make out the farmhouse and outbuildings.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: as Schaeffer, McElroy and Fergie step out of the car. They break out short-barreled twelve-gauge pumps, start TOWARD CAMERA, spreading out as they turn up the long driveway... figures of ominous intent striding through the misty dawn.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: GOING WITH the trio of gunmen... McElroy, breath smoking in the chill, eyes the terrain:
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Weird, man. No fuckin' electricity. What do you figure they plug all their shit into?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: They don't have any shit.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . KITCHEN  DAWN Where Eli is getting into a heavy coat, preparing to go out... the remains of the hearty morning breakfast are on the table. Rachel is beginning the dishes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . BARN  DAWN Book and Samuel are starting the morning milking...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . KITCHEN  DAWN Eli is preparing to extinguish the lamp when suddenly the kitchen door is kicked open and McElroy and Fergie weapons leveled, burst in. Eli reacts with angry shock as Schaeffer enters: Rachel is, for a moment, terrified.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He turns to Eli, who is standing in the middle of the room. Schaeffer flashes his badge:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: McElroy re-enters.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Suddenly Eli SHOUTS: It's deafening. Probably the loudest noise Eli has ever made:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: McElroy whips around, smashes Eli on the temple with the butt of his shotgun. Eli crumples to the floor. Rachel SCREAMS, runs to Eli.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (to Fergie) Outside (to Mac) Check out the rest of the house.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: We're police officers. We're looking for a fugitive, John Book. He's living here?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I have nothing to say to you. Get out of my house!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You speak English. Good. Now listen RACHEL (recovering) No, you listen. Get out!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Lady, I'm here to help you. This man is very dangerous. An armed criminal. (ingratiating) He's got a gun, hasn't he?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You have no right here!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: He's not in this building.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (to Eli) All right, where is he?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: John Book!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . BARN  DAY Book and Samuel in the milkhouse. They've heard Eli's outcry. Book moves to the window, looks out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: FERGIE About halfway between the barn and the house. He turns from glancing back toward the house (having heard Eli's shout) and starts again toward the barn. Gun at the ready.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . BARN  DAY As Book REACTS.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . KITCHEN  DAY Rachel kneeling next to Eli, wiping at his bruise with a damp cloth. Schaeffer looks on.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: McElroy nods, moves outside, turns toward the barns.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: He'll live.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You might have killed him!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (to McElroy) Find Fergie, check the barns. I'll watch these two.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . BARN  DAY Book still at the window, Samuel now beside him, trying to get a look.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He takes Samuel by the hand, leads him to the side door. He bends, holds the boy close.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sam turns, takes off.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Is it them?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (turning, mind racing) It's them, Sam. (he bends to the boy, takes him by the shoulders) Now, Sam, listen to me and listen to me carefully. Listen to me as you never listened before.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (interrupting) Are they going to kill you?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Listen to me, Sam! I want you to go across the new corn to Stoltzfus'. Run as fast as you can. And stay there!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What are you going to do?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I'll be all right. You just do as I say.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Don't let them hurt you.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (rising, pushing Samuel toward door) I won't. Now run. (as Sam looks back) Fast as you can!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . REAR DOOR  DAY Samuel running.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . BARN  DAY Fergie almost to the upper barn, McElroy  well back and moving slowly, circumspectly  headed toward the lower barn.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . BARN  DAY Book, at another window in the lower barn, sees McElroy heading for the milkhouse door. He can't see Fergie. He turns, crosses the cowpen area, climbs an inner ladder leading to the upper barn.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . BARN  DAY Fergie at the door to the upper barn, moving very cautiously, gun up. He eases around the doorpost, looks within.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . BARN  ANGLE PAST BOOK Beyond Book, now at the top of the ladder, we see Fergie easing into the barn. Book pulls himself up, crawls behind the wall of the mule stalls, opens gate, eases in beside Luke, urgently whispering and patting the animal to calm him. He gets to the animal's head, crouches, strokes Luke's nose. The mule's huge flanks quiver, his nostril's and eyes widen, but he makes no untoward sound. Book closes the gate.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He comes on warily, muzzle first, eyes darting.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: him as he reaches the first mule's stall, opens the gate. An edgy mule turns, eyes him, shuffles nervously. Fergie backs off, moves on.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: As he listens, tenses, hearing Fergie's feet in the fresh straw. Book eases back alongside Luke, waits.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: As he approaches Luke's stall, reaches for the gate-latch.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: As the gate swings open, Book shouts and gives Luke a whack on the back. The mule's pent-up nerves and feral energy explode in an horrendous SCREAM.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bowled backwards by the rearing animal as the gate flies open, involuntarily FIRING, suddenly finding himself under the lethal hooves of a twelve-hundred pound beast. Staggering backwards, he SCREAMS, FIRES again, the load striking the mule in its heaving chest as a flailing hoof smashes into Fergie's head and the other hoof snaps his shotgun in half like a matchstick.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: As he slips out of the stall, ducks toward the rear of the barn.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Fallen, skull smashed... and now the dying Luke's legs buckle and he collapses atop Fergie.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . BARN  DAY McElroy standing still, shock-eyed, looking toward the sound of the shots. Then starting slowly forward.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: On the porch of the house, looking toward the barn.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . FIELD  DAY Some distance from the barn, Samuel's hearing the shots, stops dead in his tracks... the sound of the shots still REVERBERATING across the quiet fields.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He hesitates, then turns, starts trotting back toward the barns.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (stricken) Mr. Book?
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . / INT. KITCHEN PORCH  DAY Rachel has moved into the open kitchen door, glances anxiously toward the barns. Starts out. Schaeffer pushes her back.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Get back in there.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: My son is out there!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Nobody's going to hurt your son...
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . BARN  DAY As McElroy, checking the safety on his twelve-gauge, steps into the barn.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . BARN  DAY McElroy flattens himself against the wall, looks around fearfully.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Only silence.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (softly) Fergie?
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . FRONT PORCH  DAY Schaeffer staring toward the barn, SHOUTS:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He listens, hears nothing, snorts, starts toward the barn checking his gun, not hurrying.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: What the hell happened?
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . KITCHEN  DAY Eli now seated at the table, holding a cloth to his head. Rachel at a window, peering out. Schaeffer on the porch
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . FIELD  DAY Samuel running as fast as he can trips as he crosses a small muddy stream, falls full length, scrambles up, runs on.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . BARN  DAY McElroy, moving very cautiously, comes around the mule stalls, stops short, stares off screen.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: FERGIE Where he lies half buried beneath the huge bulk of the mule, his head crushed like an eggshell.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: As he moves on around Fergie and the dead mule, planting each foot as if he were walking in a mine field.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Standing in shadow at the back of the barn next to a hay mow.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: MCELROY Moving toward the center of the barn.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: As he starts to move even further back, he nudges into a rope fastened to the wall behind him, He looks at it, looks up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: THE ROPE It runs from where it is fastened to the wall straight up to the center roofbeam of the barn to a trolley fixed to a track that runs the length of the roofbeam. Attached to this trolley is a big hayfork (Paul Krantz has one), U-shaped, sharply- pointed at each end of the U. the points hanging toward the floor. The thing weighs about eighty pounds, and is suspended in place by the rope anchored at the wall next to Book.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Keeping one eye on McElroy, he carefully begins to un-tie the trip rope.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Moving out toward the center of the barn, almost under the suspended hay fork. He stops short, listens. Then, either spotting a moving shadow or hearing a SOUND, he FIRES. His shot rattles off the side of a manure spreader. He SHOUTS:
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Book, you sneaky bastard, I know you're here! Come out and fight!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . BARNYARD  DAY Samuel, at the top of the barnyard, stops at the SOUND OF THE SHOT, wide-eyed. He listens for an-instant, starts a step toward the barn, then stops again, looks to a large bell suspended in a cupola by one of the outbuildings. He moves quickly to the bell, seizes the rope, pulls. The bell CLANGS loudly, Sonorously.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: On the front porch, looking around for the location of the sounding bell. He takes a step toward the barn, the stops, looks back toward the house... frustrated.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . BARN  DAY Book watches as McElroy starts to move again looking back toward the SOUNDING of the bell.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: HAY FORK Looking down we can see McElroy almost directly beneath the hay fork. The bell SOUNDING throughout. BOOK Waiting... trip rope in hand. Then:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And he lets go the trip rope.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (shouting) Hey, Mac!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: As he turns toward the SOUND of Book's voice.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: As it plummets down, causing a RATCHETING SOUND that fills the barn, even drowns out the SOUND of the bell.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Eyes darting wildly, looking up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: HAY FORK Plunging straight for him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Diving to one side.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: HAY FORK THUDDING into the barn floor like a great trident fork. Quivering there, not a foot from McElroy's head.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Staring at the fork pop-eyed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sprinting toward a ladder thrust up through an opening in the barn floor just in front of his parked car.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Spotting Book, coming up to one knee, quick-aiming, FIRING. The shot smashes the windshield of the car.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Diving, rolling, slamming into the top of the ladder, flailing down out of sight.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: then again. Emptying the gun, cursing as he begins to reload, gets to his feet, starts toward the ladder. The BELL still SOUNDING outside. The hood of the car SLOWLY POPS UP.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: As McElroy wheels at the movement of the car's hood, FIRES twice.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: LAPP BUGGY The buckshot virtually blows the dashboard off.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . BARNYARD  DAY Samuel RINGING the bell. The bell rope is short, and so is Samuel and his feet go off the ground with every swing of the rockerarm. He hangs on grimly, his black hat clinging to the back of his head, his face set against the tears that move down his cheeks.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Comes hesitantly down the path toward the barn, looking toward the sound of the bell, but also looking back in glances toward the house to make sure Rachel and Eli stay where they are. He still can't see Samuel.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: THE PORCH As Rachel starts off the porch, takes a few steps.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Turning, SHOUTING:
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: You stay put!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: She stops. She is also unable to see Samuel.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Moving out toward the barn, rounding a corner... and there is Samuel at the bellrope. He starts toward him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . FIELDS  DAY Beyond Samuel, well out in the fields of the Stoltzfus farm, Stotlzfus and others  including Hochstetler and his brothers are baling the first cutting of June hay. But the operation has come to a halt. All are looking in toward the Lapp farm, hearing the RINGING OF THE BELL (the Amish cry for help), wondering, hesitating. But now, as we watch, led by Hochstetler, they start in toward Samuel.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . BARNYARD  DAY As Schaeffer reaches Samuel, SHOUTS:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Samuel looks at him, keeps on pulling. Schaeffer quickly crosses to him, grabs him by the back of the neck, tries to pull him off the bell rope. Samuel hangs on grimly. Schaeffer yanks hard, succeeds in yanking Samuel free, shoves him roughly aside. Then Schaeffer turns, FIRES a shotgun blast into the top of the bellrope. It still hangs by several threads, so he FIRES again. The rope drops to the ground. Schaeffer reloads, turns to look at Samuel, just getting to his feet. A moment... when Schaeffer, recognizing Samuel as the Amish kid who saw McElroy kill Zenovich, perhaps thinks of disposing of the witness right then and there. But a glance toward the oncoming Amish gives him pause. He SNARLS at Sam:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Samuel gets to his feet, turns, trots off.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Cut that out!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Get down to the house and stay there!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Already halfway out to the barn, running to gather Sam in her arms... then to lead him back toward the house.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Turning, starting very slowly toward the barn.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . BARN  DAY McElroy at the top of the ladder, looking down. Then easing over, placing his feet on the rungs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He stands below in a cowpen, using the cows for cover. The cows stare balefully at him. A large goat nuzzles him, hooks at him with its horns. Book waits, watches.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: MCELROY Visible to his knees as he eases down the ladder. He stops at every rung to scrape his shoes free of the cowshit covering the rungs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He turns now to a door at the back of the pen. He un-hooks it, pulls it open, moves inside.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: BOOK He is now in a small passageway giving on to the entrance to a nearly-empty silo. Above the entrance, a ladder (interior) rises to the top of the structure. Book looks in, and up. We should get the impression that Book's been here before, expects what he sees.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Forty feet up, a patch of blue sky through an open hatch.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He steps through to the base of the ladder, then ducks beyond it into the silo. There is about two feet of old silage covering the floor. He turns, looks up the white walls.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: INSIDE SILO An inside ladder runs to the top.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: KICKBOARD Standing against the wall next to the entrance... . obviously to be inserted as the silo is filled.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Now, quickly, he ducks back out through the entrance, crosses to the door to the cowpen, very cautiously peers out..
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: McElroy at the bottom of the ladder, looking in the other direction (toward the milkhouse).
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Very carefully he shoves the cowpen door (which opens outward into the cowpen). It begins to swing very slowly open. Book immediately turns, darts back into the silo.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Turning slowly toward the cowpen... then FIRES twice as his eye catches the motion of the swinging door. His shots blow half a row of Eli's precious tools off an adjacent wall. McElroy reloads, starts across toward the door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Old Eli, at the sight of Samuel, rises from the table.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Rachel stands aside as the old man embraces Samuel long and hard. She watches as he turns to the cupboard, takes down the big family Bible. He crosses to the table, sets the book down, places his hand on its pulls Samuel to the table beside him. Rachel holds another beat as she stares at the old man helplessly, then she rushes to where she hid Book's gun, takes it down... her trembling hands take the bullets out of the coffee jar. She drops several as she tries to figure out how to open the chamber to load it. In the b.g., Eli glances up, sees what she is about... he rises and crosses to her. Samuel watches from the table.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Rachel somehow manages to open the chamber and begins to try to load the bullets. Eli's callused hand closes over hers, halting the action:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bullets are already CLATTERING to the floor from her trembling fingers as she raises her eyes to Eli's. A long beat as Rachel looks at him... Finally her fingers release the pistol and it CLATTERS to the floor. She closes her eyes. Samuel, who has gotten up, moved to a window, watches Eli and Rachel silently. Eli leads her to the table, places her hands on the Bible beneath his. They stand there and they pray.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Praise Gott!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (fiercely) No, Rachel...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I have to help him!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: It is not our way!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . SILO  DAY Book finishes putting the kickboard into the entrance.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Moving among the cows, stepping cautiously between the cowflops. The goat nudges him once, then butts him rather firmly. McElroy swats at him with the gun butt, moves to the door. As he arrives, he HEARS a noise  very slight  from the direction of the silo. He enters the passage way, looks in toward the silo entrance, He hesitates. Another slight noise. He steps in to the base of the inner ladder, looks up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: THE HATCH The patch of blue sky, forty feet up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He frowns, reaches out, grabs a rung.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . BARN  DAY Schaeffer, easing toward the mule stalls, MUTTERS, CURSES under his breath. Then he rounds the corner of the first stall... and there is Fergie with Luke the mule on top of him. Schaeffer stares, blinks... moves on spotting a spent shotgun shell near the hayfork...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . SILO  DAY Book listening at the kickboard. SOUNDS of feet, shotgun rattling against metal rungs, Book moves to the ladder on his side, starts silently up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Climbing with difficulty, shotgun clutched in one hand.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He climbs up to the second kickboard, pauses, checks the distance to the floor, starts upward again.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Amish beginning to arrive. Sam comes running, pulls Stoltzfus toward the door of the milkhouse as the other Amish look at the shot-shattered bellrope. Rachel and Eli come rapidly up the path toward the group.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . BARN  DAY Schaeffer finds another spent shotgun shell, crosses to the ladder, looks down. He sets his shotgun down, takes out his service revolver, starts down.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . SILO  DAY Book has reaches the third kickboard, about thirty feet from the ground. He checks it, turns the thumb-screws that hold it in place, places his hand on the handle, moves to one side as best he can... hangs there, listening.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Rattling up the other ladder, approaching the third kickboard.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Listening tensely, hearing McElroy arrive on the other side of the kickboard. Then, deliberately, Book makes a fist, raps on the board smartly once.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Startled, REACTING. He sets his feet, leans back against the back wall of the ladder well, brings the shotgun up, puts the muzzle against the kickboard, clicks off the safety.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We HEAR with him the thump of the muzzle, the CLICK... and, with marvelous speed, Book pulls the kickboard and drops it to the floor. McELROY  FLASH CUT Staring in, stun-eyed, already falling forward (having leaned his weight on the shotgun) as Book seizes the shotgun by the barrel, pulls inward.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: As McElroy pitches forward through the opening, SCREAMS and GRABS as he plunges past Book. The shotgun FIRES as McElroy manages to hold onto Book, and both men plunge thirty feet to the bottom of the silo.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He falls almost straight down, lands on his back, lies stunned.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: His forward motion has carried him across the silo. His head bounds off the white brick wall about five feet up... and he falls in a heap, blood gushing from his head, as...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Blinking, groaning, just beginning to stir... and, suddenly, into the frame comes a hand with a pistol in it. The muzzle is placed firmly against Book's temple.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: R Schaeffer holding the pistol. He cocks the pistol, tenses as if to FIRE (and he is actually about to)... when there is a SOUND behind him. He snaps around.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Old Stoltzfus and Samuel standing in the kickboard opening (Schaeffer having kicked the kickboard in when he heard the shot from within the silo). They stand solemnly, looking on as:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He eases the hammer down on this pistol, speaks softly:
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Okay, Johnny. On your feet.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: As Book struggles to his feet  Schaeffer holding the pistol tight to Book's head. Book turns, sees Samuel and Stoltzfus, blinks. Schaeffer shoves Book toward the opening. As Book moves toward Samuel, he speaks quietly:
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: It's okay, Sam.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: As Book and McElroy move out of the silo, down the passageway toward the milkhouse, Stoltzfus and Sam (after a glance in at the inert McElroy) follow and...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . BARN  DAY As first Stoltzfus and Samuel, then Book and Schaeffer emerge into the barnyard. Schaeffer has the muzzle of his pistol pressed firmly against Book's throat, just below his jaw. Schaeffer pulls up, frowning:
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Hold it.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: The Amishmen gathered  the Stoltzfus family, the Hochstetler brothers, et al. All staring hard at Schaeffer and Book.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . BARN / DRIVE  DAY From a high wide angle the final scene is played out. Schaeffer and Book, now moving again slowly up the drive, the Amish following along closely on both sides.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: As Schaeffer prods Book forward, warily eyeing the Amish.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Book takes a couple of steps further, then abruptly stops. The Amish stand about close, staring, no one moving. Book now slowly turns his head, looks at Schaeffer.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Eli steps forward, bloody cloth held to his head.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Get back, you people! (prodding) Keep moving, Johnny...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You're going to have to do it right here, Schaeffer.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Don't try me, Johnny!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: So... will you kill us all, then?
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: As Schaeffer's eyes waver between Book and Eli, Book slowly turns until he is facing Schaeffer... the gun now leveled and almost pressing against  Book's chest. Book locks eyes with Schaeffer. Quietly:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Book's right hand snakes out, grabs Schaeffer by the gunhand wrist, twists viciously, Schaeffer SCREAMS in pain, the gun falls out of his hand, he starts to his knees under the force of Book's grip.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: It's all over, Paul.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Move! Or you die right here!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: As Book bends, picks up the pistol, releases Schaeffer, pushes him away. Schaeffer staggers against Hochstetler, who  partly to keep him from falling, and partly (it appears) to congratulate him on his surrender  wraps one brawny arm around Schaeffer's shoulders, gives him a short approving nod... holds Schaeffer as:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Turning, looking into the crowd, finding Rachel. Their gazes meet, hold for a long MOMENT. In the eyes of both we read resignation... whatever there was between them has been terribly damaged. It is almost certainly over for them, too.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . BARN  DAY HIGH SHOT holding the moment.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . LAPP FARM  LATE AFTERNOON The door opens and Book steps out, looking somehow strange in his working suit. He looks about him, sees Samuel down by the pond.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He eases down beside Samuel. They both stare into the pond.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sam grins. Book takes him in his arms, holds him.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Are you really ever coming back?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Got to, Sam. You and I are going to a courthouse together, put some people behind bars.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Have you got your gun on now?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Sure have, Sam.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . HOUSE  DAY Book opens the door of the car, turns to find Rachel standing there with his Amish hat in hand.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He wants to kiss her, but does not. Their eyes say it all. Eli has a final word, SHOUTING from the porch.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Book gets quickly into the car.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: I want you to take this... to remember by.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Where's my baggy pants?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Here. Whenever you want them.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You be careful, John Book! Out among them English!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . DRIVEWAY  LAPP FARM  DAY As Book drives, he sees an open buggy coming down the hill toward the farm, He slows as he passes, It's Daniel Hochstetler. A long beat, and as they pass, Hochstetler gives Book an expansive tip of his hat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Book turns to look back at his rival, a doubt in his eyes. FREEZE FRAME.
direction.name: direction
